events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan application requesting funds to cover medical expenses following recent surgery.
The application was categorised under personal loans due to the applicant's intention to manage medical debt and improved clarity on use case.
A loan officer was assigned to the case to take responsibility for the review and further communication with the applicant.
The initial review was conducted focusing on loan amount appropriateness and applicant creditworthiness for covering personal medical debts.
Requested detailed medical bills, income proof, and identification documents from the applicant to proceed with further verification.
Applicant promptly submitted all requested documents including recent medical invoices and pay stubs as required for processing.
Credit check was completed revealing a satisfactory credit score with no recent defaults, supporting the applicant's eligibility.
The risk assessment concluded a low to moderate risk level given the applicant’s stable income and manageable debt-to-income ratio.
A loan offer outlining terms and repayment schedule was presented to the applicant for review and acceptance consideration.
Applicant responded positively to the offer, seeking minor clarification on interest rates before formal acceptance.
The application was escalated to senior management for special approval due to the applicant requesting rate review.
The loan was officially approved after management agreed on adjusted terms favorable to both parties.
Funds were successfully transferred to the applicant’s bank account to assist with settling the recent medical bills.
A follow-up call was made to the applicant to ensure satisfaction with loan disbursement and repayment plans.
The loan application file was closed after successful funding and post-approval follow-up confirming all matters resolved.
